clinical_study.brief_title: Physiotherapy for Infants With Breathing Difficulties
clinical_study.official_title: Physiotherapy for Infants With Acute Breathing Difficulties - a Randomized Controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock: Children who are in a hospital with respiratory distress often have difficulty breathing, have thick mucus, and may find it hard to eat normally. Sometimes physical therapy is used to treat these children, but it is not entirely known which methods help the children's condition. The aim of this study is to evaluate physical therapy for infants who have difficulty breathing and are cared for at Skåne University Hospital.

detailed_description.textblock: All children under 2 years of age who are admitted to the hospital for respiratory distress and who have previously been essentially healthy are asked to participate. The infants will be randomized to 3 groups, 1 control group and 2 intervention groups. The infants in the control group will receive the standard care at the clinic. In one intervention group the parents will receive instructions how to vary their child body position regularly, and in the other intervention group the child will receive physiotherapy regularly and the parents will carry out some treatment. Further actions in the form of inhalations or stimulation of deep breathing, will be used when needed. The children will be observed following a structured observational protocol regularly throughout the hospital stay.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Comparison of tree parallel groups, 1 control and 2 intervention groups.
study_design_info.masking_description: Randomisation is carried out with sealed envelopes that are only opened just before intervention starts. There are different care givers who carry out the observations and who perform the interventions.

arm_group.description: The infants will receive the standard care at the ward.
The parents will be guided manually and receive written information of how to change body positions of their child regularly.
The child will be given physiotherapy including light chest compressions, change of body positions and stimulation to deep breathing.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Infants hospitalized because of breathing difficulties such as bronchitis, pneumonia or other airway obstruction.
- Born at week 35 or after.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Chronically heart or lung disease
- Born before gestation week 35
- hospitalized no more than 24 hours at this occasion
